## Natural history notes

The Manatee River airplant (Tillandsia simulata) is an epiphyte growing on the branches of various trees and shrubs in the region, mostly in swamps and other moist locations. It can be distinguished by its narrowly elliptic leaf sheath, up to 2 cm wide. It produces inflorescences up to 15 cm long, with rose-colored bracts and conspicuous violet flowers.
